t: The Amazon River Doesn't Have Any Bridges – And For Good Reason | IFLScience
s: December 10, 2024 - If you need a modern example, look ... of the Amazon rainforest from Manaus to Porto Velho. The highway was built in the early 1970s under Brazil’s military dictatorship, but it was ultimately abandoned by 1988 because it was uneconomical to maintain and required constant repairs due to rapid deterioration. Some might argue that it's better that bridges don’t ever ...

t: Why are there no bridges over the Amazon River? | Live Science
s: August 9, 2022 - Despite being around 4,300 miles in length, the Amazon River surprisingly has no bridges.

t: What results can I expect from my Brand Store?
Amazon brand usage guidelines for 3-party display ads | Amazon Ads
s: Using the Amazon.com name or branding elements can help you get results. Learn more about our brand use guidelines.

t: Brand Stores: Create a brand page on Amazon for free | Amazon Ads
s: Brand Stores help build brand awareness by showcasing your brand and product catalog on your own Amazon web address. You can create a Brand Store at no additional cost—with no coding necessary.

t: Amazon Brand Registry | Sell on Amazon
s: Enroll your brand in Amazon Brand Registry to unlock tools designed to protect and build your brand, creating a better experience for your Amazon customers.

t: Sponsored Brands – Increase brand awareness | Amazon Ads
s: Sponsored ads on Amazon help build your brand and drive sales. Invest in long-term business growth by advertising your brand and products on Amazon.

t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: Criticism of Amazon - Wikipedia
s: 4 days ago - The company uses data from the marketplace which is unavailable to other retailers in that marketplace to determine which products to produce in-house and at what price point. Amazon markets products under AmazonBasics, Lark & Ro, and other private-label brands.

t: How Amazon’s big private-label business is growing and leaving small brands to protect against knockoffs
s: October 12, 2022 - Amazon continues to invest in private labels such as AmazonBasics, despite accusations that the company copies some of its top-selling third-party products.

t: The Paradox Of Growing A Brand On Amazon
s: April 26, 2021 - A new tool announced by Amazon last week looks to appease brands who have faced increasing barriers in connecting with customers who purchase their products on Amazon.

t: First Amazon bridge to open world's greatest rainforest to development | Conservation | The Guardian
s: August 6, 2010 - In the shadow of a giant bridge under construction, waiting in her dented Fiat for a ferry, Jandira Costa has no qualms about development in the Amazon. "We can't wait for it to open," she says of the 3.5km-long road over the Amazon's major tributary, the Rio Negro.

t: What Is Amazon Brand Gating? (And How to Protect Your Sales With It)
s: What is Amazon brand gating? Brand gating on Amazon prevents counterfeit sellers from selling your product, so you can earn more Amazon sales.

t: Nike to resume selling directly on Amazon for first time since 2019
s: 4 days ago - Nike confirmed to CNBC that its shoes are returning to Amazon.

t: Amazon.com: Kevin Bridges: The Brand New Boxset [DVD] [2018] : Movies & TV
Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 2 days ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: Amazon is dropping dozens of in-house brands you didn’t even know it owned | The Verge
s: August 10, 2023 - Amazon is getting rid of dozens of in-house clothing brands as it faces a potential antitrust lawsuit from the FTC, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal.

t: The Life and Death of the Amazon Brands
s: August 15, 2023 - Dozens of house brands at the world’s largest retailer are going away. Consumers knew them but felt not particular attachment. Does it matter?

t: Amazon Puts Its Own “Brands” First Above Better-Rated Products – The Markup
s: The online giant gives a leg up to hundreds of house brand and exclusive products that most people don’t know are connected to Amazon
